Class BinaryOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object

      • java.io.FilterOutputStream

          • com.joffrey_bion.binary_io.BinaryOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class BinaryOutputStream
extends BufferedOutputStream

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this stream, flushing the buffer.
      void write(String binaryString)
      Writes the given binary string to a buffer that will be written byte by byte.
      void writeBit(boolean bit)
      Writes the specified bit to this stream.
      void writeBit(int bit)
      Writes the specified bit to this stream.
      void writeCharacter(char value)
      Writes the given character's code to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Character.SIZE.
      void writeInteger(int value)
      Writes the given integer to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Integer.SIZE.
      void writeIntegerWithLength(int value)
      Writes the given int value to this stream, preceded by 5 bits indicating the number of bits used to write it.
      void writeLong(long value)
      Writes the given long to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Long.SIZE.
      void writeLongWithLength(long value)
      Writes the given long value to this stream, preceded by 6 bits indicating the number of bits used to write it.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(String binaryString)
           throws IOException
        Writes the given binary string to a buffer that will be written byte by byte.
        Parameters:
        binaryString - A binary String. This String must contain only the characters '0' or '1'.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeBit

        public void writeBit(int bit)
              throws IOException
        Writes the specified bit to this stream.
        Parameters:
        bit - The bit to write: 0 or 1
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeBit

        public void writeBit(boolean bit)
              throws IOException
        Writes the specified bit to this stream.
        Parameters:
        bit - The bit to write: true for 1, false for 0
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeLong

        public void writeLong(long value)
               throws IOException
        Writes the given long to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Long.SIZE.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeInteger

        public void writeInteger(int value)
                  throws IOException
        Writes the given integer to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Integer.SIZE.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeCharacter

        public void writeCharacter(char value)
                    throws IOException
        Writes the given character's code to this stream, with leading zeros to reach Character.SIZE.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeIntegerWithLength

        public void writeIntegerWithLength(int value)
                            throws IOException
        Writes the given int value to this stream, preceded by 5 bits indicating the number of bits used to write it.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.

      • writeLongWithLength

        public void writeLongWithLength(long value)
                         throws IOException
        Writes the given long value to this stream, preceded by 6 bits indicating the number of bits used to write it.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any I/O error occurs.
